comments.body: As I said earlier, this change really shines in `UnlimitedWindows` - it's not forced to override methods that don't make sense, just to throw exceptions. Now, the API will simply not allow you to set grace period on UnlimitedWindows, making this a compile-time check instead of a runtime one.

It's immaterial, since `UnlimitedWindows` have no end.

I chose `0` since that was the static result of the prior code: `retention - size = MAX_LONG - MAX_LONG = 0`
